abstracts.cdata!:
The loan would assist Gabon to overcome
            the economic and financial crisis brought about by the 1986
            collapse of petroleum prices. Specifically, the loan would
            support the consolidation of a recently initiated financial
            stabilization program, help lay the foundations for
            restructuring the economy and promote the growth and
            competitveness of the non-oil sectors. The first phase of
            the adjustment program focuses on reinforcing public sector
            resource management by tightening the investment budget, and
            by limiting public sector expenditures to available
            resources. Rationalizing the public enterprise sector
            through liquidation, privatization, and rehabilitation.
            Also, by instilling financial discipline and regulating the
            relationship between the State and public enterprise.
            Thirdly, the loan will enable initiative policies to promote
            private sector activities, especially small and medium
            scale. Lastly, through the reformulation of sectoral
            policies to promote agriculture, forestry, and related
            productive activities on an environmentally sound basis.
